2109410.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109410
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 001
2109410.text: Narrated Rifa'a bin Rafi' (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) was asked, 'What type of earning is best?' He replied, "A man's work with his hand and every transaction which is free from cheating or deception." [Reported by al-Bazzar; al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2109420.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109420
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 002
2109420.text: Narrated Jabir bin 'Abdullah (RA): I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) saying in the year of the Conquest, while he was in Makkah, "Allah and His Messenger have forbidden the sale of intoxicants, dead animals, swine and idols." He was asked, "O Allah's Messenger, what about the fat of a dead animal, for it is used for greasing ships, greasing the hides (of animals), and making oils for lamps?" He replied, "No, it is unlawful." Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) then added: "May Allah curse the Jews, when Allah the Most High declared the fat of such animals unlawful they melted it, then sold it and devoured its price (profit)." [Agreed upon].

2109450.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109450
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 003
2109450.text: Narrated Ibn Mas'ud (RA): I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) saying, "When two people who are arranging a business transaction disagree and there is no proof to arbitrate between them, the seller's word is final, or they may break the deal." [Reported by al-Khamsa and authenticated by al-Hakim].

2109460.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109460
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 004
2109460.text: Narrated Abu Mas'ud al-Ansari (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) prohibited the money paid for a dog, the payment of a prostitute, and the payment given to a soothsayer." [Agreed upon].

2109470.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109470
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 005
2109470.text: Narrated Jabir bin 'Abdullah (RA): I was traveling on a camel of mine which had become exhausted, so I intended to let it go free. The Prophet (ﷺ) followed me and made supplication for me and struck it. Then, it went as it had never done before. He then said, "Sell it to me for on Uqiya." I replied, "No." He again said, "Sell it to me." So I sold it to him for one Uqiya. However I stipulated that I should be allowed to ride it home. Then when I reached (home), I took the camel to him and he paid me its price in cash. I then went back and he sent someone after me. (When I came), he said, "Do you think that I asked you to reduce the value of your camel's price to take it? Take your camel and your money, for it is yours." [Agreed upon; and this is Muslim's wording].

2109480.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109480
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 006
2109480.text: Narrated [Jabir bin 'Abdullah (RA)]: A man among us declared that a slave belonging to him would be free after his death. However, he had no other property. So, the Prophet (ﷺ) sent for him (the slave) and sold him. [Agreed upon].

2109490.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109490
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 007
2109490.text: Narrated Maimuna (RA), the wife of the Prophet (ﷺ): A mouse fell into some ghee and died. The Prophet (ﷺ) was asked about it and he replied, "Throw it - and what is surrounding (touching) it - away and eat it (that which remained untouched)." [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2109500.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109500
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 008
2109500.text: Ahmad and an-Nasa'i added: "into a solid ghee."

2109510.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109510
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 009
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 009
2109510.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "If a mouse falls into ghee which is solid, throw the mouse and what is surrounding it away; but if it is in a liquid state do not go near it." [Ahmad and Abu Dawud reported it; al-Bukhari and Abu Hatim ruled it to be Wahm (an error) (in reporting it from Abu Hurairah)].

2109520.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109520
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 010
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 010
2109520.text: Narrated Abu Zubair (RA): I asked Jabir (RA) about the payment for cats and dogs and he replied, "The Prophet (ﷺ) warned sternly against that." [Reported by Muslim].

2109530.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109530
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 011
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 011
2109530.text: And an-Nasa'i added: "except a hunting dog."

2109540.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109540
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 012
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 012
2109540.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): Barirah came to her and said, "I had arranged to buy my freedom for nine Uqiya; one Uqiyah to be paid annually, so help me." 'Aishah (RA) replied, "If your people are pleased that I should pay (the amount) to them, and I shall have the right to inherit from you, I shall do so." Barira went to her people and told them about it, but they refused the offer. When she came back Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was sitting (in the house). She said, "I offered that to them, but they insisted that the right to inherit from me should be theirs." The Prophet (ﷺ) heard that and 'Aishah (RA) told him about it. So, he said to 'Aishah (RA), "Take her and stipulate that the right to inherit from her will be yours, for the right of inheritance from her will be yours, for the right of inheritance belongs only to the one who has set a slave free." 'Aishah (RA) did so. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) then stood up among the people to address them. So, after praising and extolling Allah, he said, "To proceed; what is the matter with some men who make conditions which are not in the Book of Allah, the Might, the Majestic? Any condition which is not in Allah's Book is invalid. Even if there are a hundred conditions, Allah's Decision is more valid and Allah's Condition is more binding. The right of inheritance belongs only to the one who has set a slave free." [Agreed upon and the wording is al-Bukhari's]. Muslim has: "Buy her, set her free and make the stipulation that the right to inherit from her will be yours."

2109570.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109570
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 013
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 013
2109570.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): 'Umar (RA) forbade the sale of the slave-women who have given birth to children (of their owners). He said, "She is not to be sold, bestowed as a gift or inherited. He (the owner) enjoys her as long as he lives and when he dies, she becomes free." [Reported by Malik an al-Baihaqi. He said: Some of the narrators have attributed it to the Prophet (ﷺ) mistakenly].

2109580.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109580
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 014
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 014
2109580.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): We used to sell our slave-women who had borne (our) children while the Prophet (ﷺ) was still living, and he saw no harm in that. [Reported by an-Nasa'i, Ibn Majah and ad-Daraqutni. Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2109590.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109590
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 015
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 015
2109590.text: Narrated Jabir bin 'Abdullah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) prohibited the sale of excess water. [Reported by Muslim].

2109600.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109600
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 016
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 016
2109600.text: In another narration, he added: "And hiring a camel to impregnate a she-camel."

2109610.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109610
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 017
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 017
2109610.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade the sale of a stallion's semen (to use for impregnation). [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2109620.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109620
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 018
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 018
2109620.text: Narrated [Ibn 'Umar (RA)]: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade the transaction called 'Habalal-Habalah" which was one entered into in the Jahiliya era, whereby a man bought a she-camel which was to be the offspring of a she-camel which was still in its mother's womb. [Agreed upon, and the wording is al-Bukhari's].

2109630.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109630
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 019
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 019
2109630.text: Narrated [Ibn 'Umar (RA)]: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade selling or giving away the right of inheritance from a freed slave. [Agreed upon].

2109640.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109640
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 020
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 020
2109640.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade a transaction determined by throwing stones, and the transaction which involves some uncertainty (or cheating). [Reported by Muslim].

2109650.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109650
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 021
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 021
2109650.text: Narrated [Abu Hurairah (RA)]: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "If anyone buys a grain he must not sell it till he weighs it." [Reported by Muslim].

2109660.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109660
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 022
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 022
2109660.text: Narrated [Abu Hurairah (RA)]: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade two transactions combined in one. [Reported by Ahmad and an-Nasa'i. at-Tirmidhi and Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2109670.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109670
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 023
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 023
2109670.text: Abu Dawud has: "If anyone makes to transactions combined in one he is entitled to take the lower price, or (it is considered) usury."

2109680.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109680
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 024
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 024
2109680.text: Narrated 'Amr bin Shu'aib on his father's authority from his grandfather (RA): "Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The condition of a loan combined with a sale is not lawful, now two conditions relating to one transaction, nor the profit arising from something which is not in one's charge, nor selling what is not in your possession." [Reported by al-Khamsa. at-Tirmidhi, Ibn Khuzaimah and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2109690.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109690
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 025
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 025
2109690.text: al-Hakim reported it in 'Uloom al-Hadith, from the narration of Abu Hanifah, from 'Amr bin Shu'aib, with the wording: He [the Prophet (ﷺ)] forbade a transaction (combined with) a condition. at-Tabarani reported it through this chain of narrators in al-Awsat, and it is Gharib (reported by a single narrator).

2109710.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109710
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 026
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 026
2109710.text: Narrated ['Amr bin Shu'aib on his father's authority from his grandfather (RA)]: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade the type of transaction in which a security deposit was paid. [Reported by Malik, who said, "It reached me (with mentioning its chain of narrators) on the authority of 'Amr bin Shu'aib that..." i.e., the aforesaid Hadith].

2109720.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109720
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 027
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 027
2109720.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): I bought some oil in the market and when I had taken it (from the seller), a man met me and offered to give me a good profit for it. Then, when I was about to finalize the deal with him, a man caught hold of my forearm from behind. So I turned and found that he was Zaib bin Thabit (RA). He said, "Do not sell it in the place where you have bought it, till you take it to your dwelling. This is because Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade that commodities to be sold in the place where they were bought, till the traders take them to their dwellings." [Reported by Ahmad and Abu Dawud; this wording is from Abu Dawud. Ibn Hibban and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2109730.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109730
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 028
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 028
2109730.text: Narrated [Ibn 'Umar (RA)]: I said, "O Allah's Messenger, I sell camels at al-Baqi'. I sell for Dinars and take Dirhams (for them), and sell for Dirhams, and take Dinars (for them), I take this for that and give that for this (i.e. Dinars and Dirhams)." Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) replied, "There is no harm in taking them at the current rate so long as you do not separate leaving something still to be settled (from the exchange)." [Reported by al-Khamsah and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2109740.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109740
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 029
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 029
2109740.text: Narrated [Ibn 'Umar (RA)]: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade bidding against one another (to raise the price). [Agreed upon].

2109750.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109750
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 030
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 030
2109750.text: Narrated Jabir bin 'Abdullah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade Muhaqalah, Muzabanah, and Mukhabarah. He also forbade Thunya unless it was explicit (a known amount). [Reported by al-Khamsah excluding Ibn Majah; at-Tirmidhi graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2109760.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109760
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 031
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 031
2109760.text: Narrated Anas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade Muhaqalah, Mukhadarah, Mulamasah, Munabadhah and Muzabamah. [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2109770.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109770
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 032
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 032
2109770.text: Narrated Tawus from Ibn 'Abbas (RA), Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Do not go out to meet riders (to conduct business with them), and a city-dweller must not sell for a man from the desert." I asked Ibn 'Abbas (RA), "What did he mean by 'A city-dweller must not sell for a man from the desert.'" He replied, "He should not act as a broker for him." [Agreed upon and the wording is al-Bukhari's].

2109780.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109780
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 033
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 033
2109780.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Do not go out to meet what is being brought (to market for sale). Whoever has done so and bought some of it, when its owner comes to the market he has the choice (of canceling the deal)." [Reported by Muslim].

2109790.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109790
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 034
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 034
2109790.text: Narrated [Abu Hurairah (RA)]: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade, a city-dweller to sell for a man from the desert; one to bid against another (to raise the price); that someone sell (his product) by canceling the sale of his brother; to propose (marriage) to a woman after his brother has done so; or a woman to ask to have her sister divorced in order to deprive her of what belongs to her. [Agreed upon].

2109800.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109800
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 035
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 035
2109800.text: Muslim has: "A Muslim must not offer a price above that offered by another Muslim."

2109810.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109810
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 036
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 036
2109810.text: Narrated Abu Ayub al-Ansari (RA): I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) saying, "Whoever separates a mother from her child, May Allah separate him from his beloved ones on the Day of Resurrection." [Reported by Ahmad. at-Tirmidhi and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic). However, it's chain of narrators has some weakness. But, it has a supporting narration].

2109830.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109830
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 037
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 037
2109830.text: Narrated 'Ali bin Abu Talib (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) commanded me to sell two youths who were brothers. I sold them and separated them (by selling them to different people). When I made mention of that to the Prophet (ﷺ), he said, "Find them and get them back, and do not sell them except that they are together." [Reported by Ahmad, and the narrators of his chain are reliable. Indeed Ibn Khuzaimah, Ibn al-Jarud, Ibn Hibban, al-Hakim, at-Tabarani and Ibn Qattan graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2109840.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109840
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 038
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 038
2109840.text: Narrated Anas bin Malik (RA): When prices were high in al-Madinah in the time of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ), the people said, "O Allah's Messenger, prices have become high, so fix them for us." Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) replied, Allah is the One Who fixes prices, Who withholds, gives lavishly and provides. And I hope that when I meet Allah, the Most High, none of you will have any claim on me for an injustice regarding blood or property." [Reported by al-Khamsah excluding an-Nasa'i; Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2109850.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109850
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 039
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 039
2109850.text: Narrated Ma'mar bin 'Abdullah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "None withholds goods till the price rises but a sinner." [Reported by Muslim].

2109860.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109860
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 040
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 040
2109860.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Do not tie up the udders of camels and goats. He who buys them after that (has been done) has two choices open to him after milking them: he may keep them if he wishes, or may return them along with one Sa' of dates." [Agreed upon].

2109870.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109870
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 041
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 041
2109870.text: Muslim has: "He has three days in which to decide to keep them or not."

2109880.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109880
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 042
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 042
2109880.text: Another narration by Muslim, which al-Bukhari reported as Mu'allaq (with a broken chain), has: "He must return with it one Sa' of any grain but wheat." [al-Bukhari said, "(One Sa' of) dates is mentioned in more narrations than not].

2109890.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109890
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 043
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 043
2109890.text: Narrated Ibn Mas'ud (RA): If anyone buys a goat whose udder has been tied up and he returned it, he must return it with one Sa'. [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2109900.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109900
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 044
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 044

2109910.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109910
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 045
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 045
2109910.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) once came upon a heap of grain, and when he put his hand inside it, his fingers felt some dampness. So, he asked, "What is this, O owner of the grain?" He replied, "Rain had fallen on it, O Allah's Messenger." He said, "Why did you not put it (the damp part) on the top of the foodstuff so that people might see it? Whoever cheats has nothing to do with me." [Reported by Muslim].

2109920.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109920
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 046
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 046
2109920.text: Narrated 'Abdullah bin Buraidah on his father's authority (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Whoever hoards grapes in the vintage (harvest) season till he sells them to those who make wine from them, has hastily thrown himself into Hell-fire with clear knowledge." [at-Tabarani reported it in al-Awsat with a Hasan (good) chain of narrators].

2109930.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109930
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 047
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 047
2109930.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Any profit goes to the one who bears responsibility." [Reported by al-Khamsah. al-Bukhari and Abu Dawud graded it Da'if (weak). at-Tirmidhi, Ibn Khuzaimah, Ibn Jarud, Ibn Hibban, al-Hakim and Ibn al-Qattan graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2109940.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109940
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 048
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 048
2109940.text: Narrated 'Urwa al-Bariqi (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) gave him a Dinar to buy a sacrificial animal or a sheep. He bought two sheep with it, sold one of them for a Dinar and came back to him with a goat and a Dinar. So he invoked blessings on him in his business dealings, and he was such that if he had bought soil (of the earth) he would have made profit from it. [Reported by al-Khamsah except an-Nasa'i].

2109950.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109950
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 049
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 049
2109950.text: al-Bukhari also recorded it within another Hadith but did not report its exact wording.

2109960.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109960
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 050
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 050
2109960.text: at-Tirmidhi reported a Shahid (supporting narration of similar meaning) for it from the Hadith of Hakim bin Hizam.

2109970.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109970
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 051
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 051
2109970.text: Narrated Abu Sa'id al-Khudri (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade buying what is in the wombs of domestic animals till they give birth; selling what is in their udders; buying a runaway slave; buying (something from) the spoils of war until they are divided; buying Sadaqat before they are received; and the unknown catch (find) of a diver. [Ibn Majah, al-Bazzar and ad-Daraqutni reported it with a weak chain of narrators].

2109980.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109980
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 052
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 052
2109980.text: Narrated Ibn Mas'ud (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Do not buy the fish that is in the water, for it involves uncertainty (risk)." [Reported by Ahmad who indicated that the correct view is that it is Mawquf (saying of a Companion, i.e. Ibn Mas'ud].

2109990.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2109990
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 053
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 053
2109990.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade the selling of a fruit till it becomes ripe, or the selling of fur which is (still) on the back (of an animal) or milk which is (still) in the udder. [Reported by at-Tabarani in al-Awsat. ad-Daraqutni also reported it].

2110000.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110000
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 054
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 054
2110000.text: Abu Dawud reported in al-Marasil as a saying of 'Ikrimah, and that is the strongest opinion.

2110010.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110010
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 055
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 055
2110010.text: He also reported it Mawquf (as a saying of a Companion, i.e.) Ibn 'Abbas with a strong chain of narrators, and al-Baihaqi held it to the most correct narration.

2110020.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110020
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 056
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 056
2110020.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade the sale of what is in the womb of a she-camel, and the semen that is in the body of a male-camel. [Reported by al-Bazzar and there is weakness in its Isnad (chain of narrators)].

2110030.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110030
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 057
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 057
2110030.text: Narrated [Abu Hurairah (RA)]: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Whoever accepts back what he sold to a Muslim, Allah will forgive his fault." [Reported by Abu Dawud and Ibn Majah. Ibn Hibban and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2110040.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110040
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 058
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 058
2110040.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Both parties in a business transaction have a right to annul the transaction, so long as they have not separated and remain together; or one of them gives the other the choice (to conclude or annul the transaction); so, if one of them gives the other the choice (to conclude or annul the transaction) and then they make the transaction accordingly, the transaction then becomes binding; or if they separate after having made the transaction and none of them has annulled it, the transaction then becomes binding." [Agreed upon, and the wording is Muslim's].

2110050.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110050
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 059
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 059
2110050.text: Narrated 'Amr bin Shu'aib on his father's authority from his grandfather (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "The two parties (seller and buyer) in a business transaction have a choice (to annul it) until they separated (from one another), unless it is a transaction with the right to annul it attached to it; and it is not allowed for one to separated from the other for fear that he may cancel the deal." [Reported by al-Khamsah except Ibn Majah. ad-Daraqutni, Ibn Khuzaimah and Ibn al-Jarud also reported it].

2110060.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110060
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 060
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 060
2110060.text: Another narration has: "till they separated from their place (of transaction)."

2110070.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110070
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 061
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 061
2110070.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): A man told Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) that he was being deceived (cheated) in business transactions, and he replied, "When you make a purchase say, 'Deceiving (cheating) is not allowed (i.e. he has the choice to return the goods if he wills).'" [Agreed upon].

2110080.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110080
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 062
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 062
2110080.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) cursed the one who accepts usury, the one who gives it, the one who records it and the two witnesses to it, saying, "They are all the same." [Reported by Muslim].

2110090.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110090
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 063
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 063
2110090.text: al-Bukhari reported something similar from the Hadith of Abu Juhaifah.

2110100.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110100
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 064
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 064
2110100.text: Narrated 'Abdullah bin Mas'ud (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Usury has seventy-three categories, the least one in sin is as that of a man who marries (has sexual relations with) his mother, and the very essence of usury is the (violation of the) honor of a Muslim man." [Ibn Majah reported it in a short form and al-Hakim in a complete one. The latter also graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2110110.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110110
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 065
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 065
2110110.text: Narrated Abu Sa'id al-Khudri (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Do not sell gold for gold unless it is the same amount for the same amount, and do not make one amount greater than the other. Do not sell silver for silver unless it is the same amount for the same amount, and do not make one amount greater than the other. And do not sell that (cash money) which is not present (at the time of the transaction) for that (cash money) which is present." [Agreed upon].

2110120.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110120
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 066
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 066
2110120.text: Narrated 'Ubadah bin as-Samit (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Gold is to be paid for with gold, silver with silver, wheat with wheat, barley with barley, dates with dates, and salt with salt, same quantity for same quantity and equal for equal, hand to hand (i.e. payment being made on the spot). If these classes differ, sell as you wish as long as payment is made on the spot." [Reported by Muslim].

2110130.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110130
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 067
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 067
2110130.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Gold is to be paid for with gold, both being of equal weight and of same quantities; silver is to be paid for with silver, both being of equal weight and of same quantities. If anyone gives more or asks for more of it, it is then usury." [Reported by Muslim].

2110140.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110140
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 068
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 068
2110140.text: Narrated Abu Sa'id al-Khudri and Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) appointed a man over Khaibar and he brought him dates of a very fine quality. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) asked, "Are all the dates of Khaibar like this?" He replied, "I swear by Allah that they are certainly not, O Allah's Messenger. We take one Sa' of this kind for two, and even for three (of lesser quality). So Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Do not do so. Sell the mixed dates for Dirhams, then buy the very fine dates with the Dirhams." And he said that the same applies when things are sold by weight. [Agreed upon].

2110150.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110150
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 069
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 069
2110150.text: Muslim has: "and so is (that which is sold by) weight."

2110160.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110160
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 070
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 070
2110160.text: Narrated Jabir bin 'Abdullah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade selling a quantity of dates whose measure was unknown for a specified (known) quantity of dates. [Reported by Muslim].

2110170.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110170
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 071
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 071
2110170.text: Narrated Ma'mar bin 'Abdullah (RA): I used to hear Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) say, "Food (may be sold) for food, of same quantities." Our food at that time consisted of barley. [Reported by Muslim].

2110180.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110180
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 072
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 072
2110180.text: Narrated Fadala bin 'Ubaid (RA): I bought a necklace for twelve Dinars at the battle of Khaibar and it contained gold and gems. I considered them separately and found that it was worth more than twelve Dinars. I told the Prophet (ﷺ) about that and he said, "It must not be sold till the contents are considered separately." [Reported by Muslim].

2110190.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110190
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 073
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 073
2110190.text: Narrated Samura bin Jundub (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade selling animals for animals when payment was to be made at a later date. [Reported by al-Khamsah. Ibn al-Jarud and at-Tirmidhi graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2110200.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110200
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 074
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 074
2110200.text: Narrated 'Abdullah bin 'Amr bin al-'Aar (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) commanded him to equip an army. Then, when the camels were insufficient, he commanded him to keep back the young camels of Sadaqah. He said, "I was taking a camel to be replaced by two when the camels of Sadaqah came." [Reported by al-Hakim and al-Baihaqi; its narrators are reliable].

2110210.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110210
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 075
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 075
2110210.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) say, "If you sell anything on credit to anyone, on the condition that you will buy it back for a lower price (al-'Einah), take hold of the tails of cattle, become pleased with agriculture and give up Jihad - Allah will make disgrace prevail over you and will not remove it from you till you return to your religion." [Reported by Abu Dawud from the narration of Nafi' on the authority of Ibn 'Umar (RA), but there is a defect in its chain].

2110220.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110220
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 076
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 076
2110220.text: Ahmad reported something similar from the narration of 'Ata. Its narrators are reliable and Ibn al-Qattan graded it Sahih (authentic).

2110230.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110230
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 077
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 077
2110230.text: Narrated Abu Umamah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Whoever intercedes for his brother and that one gives him a gift for that (intercession) which he accepts, he has engaged in one of the most terrible types of Riba (undeserving increase in something)." [Reported by Ahmad and Abu Dawud, but one of its narrators' reliability has been doubted].

2110240.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110240
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 078
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 078
2110240.text: Narrated 'Abdullah bin 'Amr bin al-Aas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) cursed the one who bribes and the one who takes bribes. [Reported by Abu Dawud and at-Tirmidhi, who graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2110250.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110250
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 079
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 079
2110250.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade al-Muzabanah, which means that a man sells the fruit of his garden, if it consists of palm-trees (fresh dates), for dried dates by measure; or if it consists of grapes (on the vines), for raisins by measure; or if it is unpicked crops, he sells it for a measured amount of picked crops. He forbade all that. [Agreed upon]. Narrated Sa'd bin Abu Waqqas (RA): I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) being asked about buying fresh dates for dry ones. He replied, "Will fresh dates diminish when they become dry?" They answered, "Yes." So he forbade that. [Reported by al-Khamsah and graded Sahih (authentic) by Ibn al-Madini, at-Tirmidhi, Ibn Hibban and al-Hakim].

2110260.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110260
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 080
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 080
2110260.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade selling a debt to be paid at a future date for another i.e., a debt for a debt. [Reported by Ishaq and al-Bazzar with a Da;if (weak) chain].

2110270.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110270
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 081
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 081
2110270.text: Narrated Zaid bin THabit (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) gave permission regarding al-'Araya for its sale on the basis of a calculation (of what the dates would be when dry) by measure. [Agreed upon].

2110280.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110280
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 082
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 082
2110280.text: Muslim has: "He gave permission regarding al-'Araya (for its sale) in which the household buys its fruit on the basis of a calculation (of what the dates would be when dry), yet they could eat them fresh (from the tree).

2110290.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110290
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 083
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 083
2110290.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) gave permission regarding the sale of al-'Araya, on the basis of calculation of their amount, for dry dates, on the condition that they be less than five Awsuq, or amounting to five Awsuq. [Agreed upon].

2110300.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110300
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 084
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 084
2110300.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade the sale of fruits till they appear to ripe, forbidding it both to the seller and to the buyer. [Agreed upon].

2110310.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110310
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 085
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 085
2110310.text: A narration has: "When he was asked about (the words): 'appear to be ripe'?" He (ﷺ) replied, "Till they were safe from damage or disease."

2110320.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110320
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 086
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 086
2110320.text: Narrated Anas bin Malik (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade the sale of fruits till they become colorful. He was asked what that meant, he replied, "Till they become reddish and yellowish." [Agreed upon and the wording is al-Bukhari's].

2110330.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110330
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 087
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 087
2110330.text: Narrated Anas bin Malik (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade the sale of grapes till they become black (i.e. ripe) and the sale of grain till it becomes hard (i.e. ripe). [Reported by al-Khamsah except an-Nasa'i and graded Sahih (authentic) by Ibn Hibban and al-Hakim].

2110340.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110340
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 088
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 088
2110340.text: Narrated Jabir bin 'Abdullah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "If you sell some fruit to your brother and it was struck by blight, it would not be lawful for you to take anything from him. How can you take your brother's money unjustly?" [Reported by Muslim].

2110350.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110350
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 089
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 089
2110350.text: In another narration he has: "The Prophet (ﷺ) commanded that unforeseen loss be remitted in respect of what is affected by blight."

2110360.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110360
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 090
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 090
2110360.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "If anyone buys a palm tree after it has been pollinated, the fruits belong to the seller who has sold them unless the buyer makes a condition." [Agreed upon].

2110370.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110370
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 091
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 091
2110370.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): When the Prophet (ﷺ) came to al-Madinah, they were paying one and two years in advance for fruits. So he (ﷺ) said: "Those who paid in advance for fruits must do so for a specified measurement and weight, and for a specified time." [Agreed upon].

2110380.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110380
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 092
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 092
2110380.text: al-Bukhari has: "Those who pay in advance for anything."

2110390.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110390
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 093
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 093
2110390.text: Narrated 'Abdur-Rahman bin Abza and 'Abdullah bin Abu Aufa (RA): "We were getting a portion of the spoils of war along with Allah's Messenger (ﷺ), and some Nabateans (Arabs who mixed with non-Arabs and corrupted their language and lineage) from those of Syria used to come to us and we would pay in advance to them for wheat, barley and raisins - A narration has: 'and olive oil' - for a specified fixed time." It was asked, "Did they have standing crop?" They replied, "We were not asking them about that." [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2110400.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110400
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 094
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 094
2110400.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Whoever accepts other people's wealth intending to pay it back, Allah will pay it back for him. And whoever accepts it intending to waste it, Allah, the Most High, will waste (destroy) him." [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2110410.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110410
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 095
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 095
2110410.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): I said, "O Messenger of Allah, so-and-so has brought you clothes from Syria. What if you sent someone to him, and you get from him two garments on credit till it is easy for you to repay?" So he sent someone to him, but he refused. [al-Hakim and al-Baihaqi reported it, and its narrators are reliable].

2110420.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110420
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 096
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 096
2110420.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "An animal may be ridden, due to what is spent on it, when it is in pledge; and the milk of a camel may be drunk, due to what is spent on it, when it is in pledge. And the responsibility of spending on it is upon the one who rides (it) and drinks (its milk)." [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2110430.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110430
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 097
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 097
2110430.text: Narrated [Abu Hurairah (RA)]: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "A pledge does not become lost to its owner when he does not redeem it in time. Any increase in its value goes to him and any lost must be borne by him." [Reported by ad-Daraqutni and al-Hakim. Its narrators are reliable. However, the strongest opinion is that it is Mursal (missing link in the chain after the Tabi'i) as reported by Abu Dawud and others].

2110440.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110440
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 098
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 098
2110440.text: Narrated Abu Rafi' (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) borrowed a young camel from a man. So, when some Sadaqa camels came to him he ordered Abu Rafi (RA) to re-pay the man his young camel. He told him (ﷺ), "I can only find an excellent camel in its seventh year." He said, "Give it to him, for the best of people is he who discharges his debt in the best manner." [Reported by Muslim].

2110460.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110460
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 099
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 099
2110460.text: Narrated 'Ali (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Every loan, which leads to a benefit, is usury." [al-Harith bin Abu Usamah reported it, but its chain of narrators is Saaqit (containing an extremely weak narrator)].

2110470.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110470
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 100
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 100
2110470.text: The aforesaid Hadith has a weak supporting narration, on the authority of Fadalah bin 'Ubaid (RA) reported by al-Baihaqi.

2110480.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110480
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 101
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 101
2110480.text: It also has another Mawquf (saying of a Companion) narration from 'Abdullah bin Salam (RA) reported by al-Bukhari.

2110490.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110490
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 102
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 102
2110490.text: Narrated Abu Bakr bin 'Abdur-Rahman on the authority of Abu Hurairah (RA): We heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) say: "If a creditor finds his very property with a debtor who becomes bankrupt, he is more entitled to it than anyone else." [Agreed upon].

2110500.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110500
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 103
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 103
2110500.text: Abu Dawud and Malik reported the aforesaid Hadith from the narration of Abu Bakr bin 'Abdur-Rahman, as Mursal (broken chain after the Tabi'i), with this wording: "If anyone sells some goods (on credit) and the one who buys them becomes bankrupt, and the seller does not recover any of the price of his goods, and he then finds his very goods (with him), he is more entitled to them (than anyone else). However, if the buyer dies, the owner of the goods finds his actual goods he has most right to them."

2110510.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110510
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 104
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 104
2110510.text: al-Baihaqi reported it with a full chain of narrators but graded it weak, following Abu Dawud.

2110520.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110520
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 105
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 105
2110520.text: Abu Dawud and Ibn Majah reported the aforesaid Hadith from the narration of 'Umar bin Khalda which has: "We went to Abu Hurairah (RA) regarding a friend of ours who was bankrupt. He said, "I shall certainly pronounce judgment about him in accordance with the judgement of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). Whoever becomes bankrupt or dies, and a person finds his actual goods (remaining with that man), he has most right to them.'" [al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic); Abu Dawud graded it Da'if (weak). He also considered this addition of the mention of 'death' to be weak].

2110530.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110530
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 106
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 106
2110530.text: Narrated 'Amr bin ash-Sharid on the authority of his father: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Delay in payment on the part of one who possesses the means, makes it lawful to dishonor and punish him." [Abu Dawud and an-Nasa'i reported it. al-Bukhari reported it as Mu'allaq (broken chain from the side of the Hadith collector), and Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2110540.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110540
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 107
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 107
2110540.text: Narrated Abu Sa'id al-Khudri (RA): In the time of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) a man suffered a loss affecting fruits he had bought, owed a large debt and became bankrupt. So, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said to the people, "Give him Sadaqah (charity)." Hence, the people gave him charity. However, that was not enough to repay his debt in full. Therefore, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said to the creditors, "Take whatever you find, and you will have nothing other than that." [Reported by Muslim].

2110550.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110550
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 108
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 108
2110550.text: Narrated Ibn Ka'b bin Malik (RA) on the authority of his father: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) seized the wealth of Mu'adh and sold it in return for a debt he was indebted for. [ad-Daraqutni reported it, and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic). Abu Dawud reported it as Mursal (missing link after the Tabi'i) and considered that the strongest opinion is that it is Mursal].

2110560.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110560
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 109
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 109
2110560.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): I was brought before the Prophet (ﷺ) on the Day of Uhud when I Was fourteen years old, but he did not give me permission (to fight). I was afterwards brought to him on the Day of al-Khandaq (the Battle of Trench) when I was fifteen years of age, and he gave me permission (to fight). [Agreed upon].

2110570.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110570
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 110
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 110
2110570.text: al-Baihaqi's narration has: "He did not give me permission (to fight), and did not consider me has having attained puberty." [Ibn Khuzaimah graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2110580.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110580
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 111
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 111
2110580.text: Narrated 'Atiyyah al-Qurazi (RA): We were brought before the Prophet (ﷺ) on the day of Quraizah. Those who had began to grow hair (on their private parts) were killed, while who had not, were set free. I was among those who had not begun to grow hair, so I was set free. [Reported by al-Arba'a. Ibn Hibban and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2110590.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110590
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 112
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 112
2110590.text: Narrated 'Amr bin Shu'aib on his father'ss authority from his grandfather (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "It is not permissible to give a gift without her husband's permission."

2110600.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110600
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 113
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 113
2110600.text: Another wording is: "It is not permissible for a woman to dispose anything of her wealth if her husband is responsible for her." [Reported by Ahmad and the collectors of as-Sunan except at-Tirmidhi and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2110610.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110610
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 114
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 114
2110610.text: Narrated Qabisa bin Mukhariq al-Hilali (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Begging is not lawful except to one of three (people): a man who has become a guarantor for a payment, for whom begging is lawful till he gets it, after which he must stop begging; a man whose wealth has been destroyed by a calamity which has befallen him, for whom begging is lawful till he gets what will support life; and a man who has been struck by poverty, the genuineness of which is confirmed by three intelligent members of his people, so it is lawful for him to beg." [Reported by Muslim].

2110620.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110620
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 115
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 115
2110620.text: Narrated 'Amr bin 'Auf al-Muzani (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Reconciliation is permissible between Muslims, except one which makes unlawful something which is lawful, or makes lawful something which is unlawful; and Muslims must abide by their conditions (which they have made), except for a condition which makes unlawful something which is lawful, or makes lawful something which is unlawful." [at-Tirmidhi reported it and graded it Sahih (authentic)]. However, the Hadith scholars criticized him (for grading this Hadith as Sahih) because the narration of Kathir bin 'Abdullah bin 'Amr bin 'Auf is weak. It is as though at-Tirmidhi considered it (reliable) due to its many chains of narration. Ibn Hibban declared the aforesaid Hadith to be Sahih (authentic) from the narration of Abu Hurairah (RA).

2110660.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110660
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 116
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 116
2110660.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "One must not prevent his neighbor from fixing a wooden peg in his wall." Abu Hurairah (RA) then said, "Why do I see you turning away (averse to this Sunnah)? I swear by Allah that I will always narrate it to you." [Agreed upon].

2110670.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110670
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 117
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 117
2110670.text: Narrated Abu Humaid as-Sa'idi (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "It is not lawful for a person to take his brother's stick except if he is pleased with such." [Ibn Hibban and al-Hakim reported it in their two Sahih books].

2110680.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110680
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 118
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 118
2110680.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Delay in payment by a rich man is injustice. So, if one of you is referred for payment to a wealthy man he should accept the reference." [Agreed upon].

2110690.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110690
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 119
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 119
2110690.text: A narration by Ahmad has: "And if anyone is referred to another, let him accept that."

2110700.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110700
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 120
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 120
2110700.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): A man from among us died, so we washed, embalmed and shrouded him. We then brought him to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and asked him to pray over him. He went forward some steps and then asked, "Does he have any debt against him?" We replied, "Two Dinars." He turned away, but Abu Qatada (RA) took upon himself the bearing of them. We then came to him (again) (ﷺ) and Abu Qatada (RA) said: "I shall discharge the two Dinars." Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) thereupon said, "[Will you be responsible for paying them as] a right to the creditor; and the dead man will then be free from them?" He replied, "Yes." So, he prayed over him. [Reported by Ahmad, Abu Dawud, and an-Nasa'i. Ibn Hibban and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2110710.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110710
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 121
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 121
2110710.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): A man who had died in debt would be brought to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and he would ask, "Has he left anything to discharge his debt?" If he was told that he left enough he would pray over him. Otherwise, he would say, "Pray over your companion." Then, when Allah brought the conquests (of other lands) at his hands he said, "I am closer to the believers than their own selves. So, whoever dies leaving a debt, the responsibility for repaying it shall be upon me." [Agreed upon].

2110720.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110720
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 122
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 122
2110720.text: A narration by al-Bukhari has: "Whoever dies and leavings nothing to discharge his debt..."

2110730.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110730
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 123
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 123
2110730.text: Narrated 'Amr bin Shu'aib on his father's authority from his grandfather (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "No surety is allowed regarding a prescribed punishment." [Reported by al-Baihaqi with a Da'if (weak) chain of narrators].

2110740.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110740
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 124
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 124
2110740.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Allah, the Most High, said, 'I am the third (partner) of two partners as long as one of them does not cheat the his companion. Then, if he cheats (his partner) I depart from them.'" [Reported by Abu Dawud and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2110750.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110750
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 125
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 125
2110750.text: Narrated as-Saib al-Makhzumi (RA): That he was the partner of the Prophet (ﷺ) before the Prophethood. Then, he came (to Makkah) on the day of the Conquest (of Makkah), and he (the Prophet) said: "Welcome to my brother and partner." [Reported by Ahmad, Abu Dawud and Ibn Majah].

2110760.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110760
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 126
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 126
2110760.text: Narrated 'Abdullah bin Mas'ud (RA): "Ammar, Sa'd and I agrred to be partners in whatever we would get (from the spoils of war) on the day of Badr." The narrator quoted the rest of the Hadith which concludes: "Then Sa'd brought two captives, but neither Ammar nor I brought anything." [Reported by an-Nasa'i and others].

2110770.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110770
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 127
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 127
2110770.text: Narrated Jabir bin 'Abdullah (RA): I intended to go to Khaibar, so I went to the Prophet (ﷺ) and he said, "When you meet my agent at Khaibar take fifteen Wasq (of dates) from him." [Abu Dawud reported and graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2110780.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110780
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 128
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 128
2110780.text: Narrated 'Urwa al-Bariqi (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) sent him with a Dinar to buy a sacrificial animal for him. [The reporter mentioned the rest of the Hadith. al-Bukhari reported it in the context of another previously mentioned Hadith].

2110790.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110790
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 129
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 129
2110790.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): "Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) sent 'Umar to collect the Sadaqah." The reported mentioned the rest of the Hadith. [Agreed upon].

2110800.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110800
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 130
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 130
2110800.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): "The Prophet (ﷺ) slaughtered sixty-three (sacrificial) camels and ordered 'Ali to slaughter the remainder [thirty-seven]." The reported mentioned the rest of the Hadith. [Reported by Muslim].

2110810.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110810
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 131
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 131
2110810.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA) regarding the story of the hired servant: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Unais, go (in the morning) to this man's wife, and if she confesses, stone her to death." The reported mentioned the rest of the previous Hadith. [Agreed upon].

2110830.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110830
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 132
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 132
2110830.text: Narrated Abu Dhar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said to me, "Say the truth even though it is bitter (i.e. difficult to admit)." [Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic) as a part of a long Hadith].

2110840.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110840
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 133
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 133
2110840.text: Narrated Samura bin Jundub (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The hand (which takes) is responsible for what it has taken till it returns it." [Reported by Ahmad and al-Arba'a. al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2110850.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110850
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 134
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 134
2110850.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Give back what has been entrusted (to you) to him who has entrusted you, and do not violate the trust of him who violates your trust." [Reported by at-Tirmidhi and Abu Dawud; at-Tirmidhi graded it Hasan (good) and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic). Abu Hatim ar-Razi considered it Munkar (rejected)].

2110860.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110860
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 135
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 135
2110860.text: Narrated Ya'la bin Umaiya (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said to me, "When my messengers come to you, give them thirty coats of armor." I asked, "O Allah's Messenger, is it a loan with a guarantee (of its return), or a borrowed object that must be returned?" He replied, "No, it is a borrowed object that must be returned." [Reported by Ahmad, Abu Dawud and an-Nasa'i. Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2110870.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110870
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 136
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 136
2110870.text: Narrated Safwan bin Umaiya (RA): At the battle of Hunain, the Prophet (ﷺ) borrowed coats of mail from him and he asked, "Are you taking them by force, O Muhammad (ﷺ)?" He replied, "No, it is a loan with a guarantee of their reutrn." [Reported by Abu Dawud and an-Nasa'i; al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2110880.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110880
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 137
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 137
2110880.text: He also reported for this Hadith a Shahid (supporting narration) which is weak, from Ibn 'Abbas.

2110890.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110890
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 138
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 138
2110890.text: Narrated Sa'id bin Zaid (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "If anyone takes a span of land unjustly, on the Day of Resurrection Allah will strangle him with it from seven earths." [Agreed upon].

2110900.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110900
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 139
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 139
2110900.text: Narrated Anas (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) was with one of his wives when one of the Mothers of the Believers (another of his wives) sent a bowl containing food with a servant of hers. Then, she (in whose house he was) struck it with her hand and the bowl was broken. He collected the pieces of the bowl and began to collect the follow in it and said, "You eat," and gave an unbroken bowl to the messenger (servant) and kept the broken one. [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2110910.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110910
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 140
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 140
2110910.text: at-Tirmidhi named the one who broke it as 'Aishah (RA) and added: The Prophet (ﷺ) then said, "Food for food, and a vessel for a vessel." [at-Tirmidhi graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2110920.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110920
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 141
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 141
2110920.text: Narrated Rafi' bin Khadij (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Whoever sows in the land of a people without their permission, he has no right to any of the crop. However, he is entitled to what he spent on it." [Reported by Ahmad and al-Arba'a except an-Nasa'i. at-Tirmidhi graded it Hasan (good).

2110930.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110930
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 142
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 142
2110930.text: It has been said that al-Bukhari graded it Da'if (weak).

2110940.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110940
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 143
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 143
2110940.text: Narrated 'Urwa bin az-Zubair (RA): A man among the Companions of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Two men brought a dispute before Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) concerning a land in which one of them had planted palm trees and the land belonged to the other. So, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) ruled that the land belongs to its owner, and commanded the owner of the palm trees to uproot his palm trees. He said, "The labor of an unjust person has no right." [Reported by Abu Dawud and its chain of narrators is Hasan (good). The last (quoted) part of the aforesaid Hadith is found in the books of the collections of as-Sunan, from 'Urwa's narration on the authority of Sa'id bin Zaid.

2110960.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110960
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 144
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 144
2110960.text: However, there is disagreement regarding whether it is Mawsul (an unbroken chain) or Mursal (missing link after the Tabi'i) as well as the determination of the name of the Companion who heard it from the Prophet (ﷺ).

2110970.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110970
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 145
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 145
2110970.text: Narrated Abu Bakra (RA): In his Khutbah (religious talk - sermon) on the Day of Sacrifice at Mina, the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Your blood and your property and your honor are forbidden for you to violate, like the sacredness of this day of yours, in this month of yours, in this city of yours." [Agreed upon].

2110980.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110980
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 146
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 146
2110980.text: Narrated Jabir bin 'Abdullah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) ruled that the option to buy a partner's share in property is applicable to everything that has not been divided. However, when boundaries are fixed and separate roads are made there is no partner's option." [Agreed upon; the wording is al-Bukhari's].

2110990.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2110990
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 147
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 147
2110990.text: Muslims' narration has: "The option to buy a partner's share in property is applicable to everything which is shared, whether land, a dwelling or a garden and it is not lawful to sell before informing one's partner."

2111000.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111000
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 148
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 148
2111000.text: at-Tahawi's narration has: "The Prophet (ﷺ) ruled for the right of partner's option regarding everything." [Its narrators are reliable].

2111010.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111010
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 149
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 149
2111010.text: Narrated Abu Rafi' (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The neighbor has more right (to be given preference) to the property which is near to him." [al-Bukhari reported it, and there is a story related to it].

2111020.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111020
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 150
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 150
2111020.text: Narrated Anas bin Malik (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The neighbor of the house has the most right to buy it." [Reported by an-Nasa'i. Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic), but it (this chain from Qatada from Anas) has a defect].

2111030.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111030
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 151
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 151
2111030.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The neighbor is most entitled to the right of option to buy his neighbor's property, and its exercise should be waited for, even if he is absent, if the two properties have one road." [Reported by Ahmad and al-Arba'a; its narrators are reliable (thiqah)].

2111040.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111040
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 152
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 152
2111040.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "The option to buy neighboring property is like loosening the knot (which restraints the camel)." [Reported by Ibn Majah and al-Bazzar, who added: "And there is no option to buy a neighboring property for one who is absent." Its chain of narrators is Da'if (weak)].

2111050.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111050
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 153
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 153
2111050.text: Narrated Suhaib (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "There are three things which contain blessings: A business transaction in which payment is agreed on a fixed later time, al-Muqaradah (speculative partnership), and mixing wheat and barley for one's household use but not for sale." [Reported by Ibn Majah through a Da'if (weak) chain of narrators].

2111060.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111060
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 154
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 154
2111060.text: Narrated al-Hakim bin Hazim (RA): He used to make a condition on the man to whom he gave his property in al-Muqaradah (to trade with, and the profit being shared between them), that: "You should not trade with my property in living beings, and do not transport it by sea, and do not settle with it at the bottom of a river-bed; and if you do any of the aforesaid acts you should then guarantee my property." [ad-Daraqutni reported it and its narrators are reliable (thiqah)].

2111070.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111070
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 155
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 155
2111070.text: Malik said in al-Muwatta' from al-'Ala bin 'Abdur-Rahman bin Ya'qub from his father on the authority of his grandfather that he traded with some property belonging to 'Uthman (RA) so that the profit would be divided between them. [This hadith is Mawquf (saying of a Companion) Sahih (authentic)].

2111080.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111080
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 156
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 156
2111080.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) had agreed with the people of Khaibar to give (to the Muslim authority) half what it produced of fruits or crops. [Agreed upon].

2111090.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111090
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 157
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 157
2111090.text: A narration by al-Bukhari and Muslim has: They asked him (ﷺ) to allow them to stay on the land, on condition that they should do all the cultivation and have half the dates. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) replied to them, "We shall allow you to stay on the land, on that condition, as long as we wish." So they remained on the land till 'Umar (RA) expelled them.

2111100.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111100
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 158
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 158
2111100.text: Muslim has: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) handed over to the Jews of Khaibar, the palm-trees and the land of Khaibar, on condition that they should employ their own resources in working on it and keep half of its produce.

2111110.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111110
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 159
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 159
2111110.text: Narrated Hanzala bin Qais (RA): I asked Rafi' bin Khadij (RA) about renting land for gold and silver and he replied, "There is no harm in that, as the people used to rent land in the time of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) for what grew by the river-beds, and the edges of the brooks/streams, or for a portion of the crop. However, sometimes this portion of the crop would be destroyed while the other is saved, or vice-versa. Thus, there would be no wages to pay the people (the owners of the land) except for the portion which produced a crop." For this reason, he warned against this (practice). However, if it is (rented) for something known and guaranteed, then there is no harm in it. [Muslim reported it]. This narration contains a clarification of what was mentioned in general terms in the previous narration of al-Bukhari and Muslim, regarding the general prohibition of renting out land.

2111130.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111130
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 160
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 160
2111130.text: Narrated Thabit bin Dahhak (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade al-Muzara'ah (employing people on land for a share of the produce), and ordered al-Mu'ajara (renting it out for cash). [Reported by Muslim].

2111140.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111140
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 161
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 161
2111140.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) had himself cupped and gave the one who cupped him his pay; and if it were prohibited he would not have given him (his pay). [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2111150.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111150
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 162
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 162
2111150.text: Narrated Rafi' bin Khadij (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The earnings of a cupper (Hajjam) are impure." [Reported by Muslim].

2111160.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111160
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 163
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 163
2111160.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Allah, the Great and Glorious, has said, "There are three whose adversary I shall be on the Day of Resurrection: A man who gave a promise in My Name and then betrayed; a man who sold a free man and consumed his price; and a man who hired a worker and, after receiving full service from him, did not give him his wages.'" [Reported by Muslim].

2111170.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111170
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 164
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 164
2111170.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The most worthy thing for which you receive payment is Allah's Book." [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2111180.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111180
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 165
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 165
2111180.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Give the hired worker his wage before his sweat dries." [Reported by Ibn Majah].

2111190.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111190
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 166
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 166
2111190.text: Narrated Abu Sa'id al-Khudri (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Whoever hires a worker should pay him his wages in full." [Reported by 'Abdur-Razzaq, and it has Inqita' (a break) in it's chain of narrators. al-Baihaqi reported it Mawsul (unbroken chain) through the narration of Abu Hanifah].

2111200.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111200
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 167
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 167
2111200.text: Narrated 'Urwa from 'Aishah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "He who develops land that does not belong to anyone, has the most right to it." 'Urwa said that 'Umar ruled according to that during his caliphate. [Reported by al-Bukhari]

2111210.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111210
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 168
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 168
2111210.text: Narrated Sa'id bin Zaid (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "If anyone makes a barren land productive, then it belongs to him." [Reported by ath-Thalatha. at-Tirmidhi graded it Hasan (good)].

2111220.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111220
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 169
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 169
2111220.text: And he (at-Tirmidhi) said that it was reported in a Mursal (missing link after the Tabi'i) form, which is the case. However, there is disagreement regarding the Companion who heard it from the Prophet (ﷺ), and it has been said that it was Jabir, 'Aishah or 'Abdullah bin 'Umar, and the strongest opinion is that it was the first one (i.e. Jabir).

2111230.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111230
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 170
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 170
2111230.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA) that as-Sa'b bin Jaththamah al-Laithi (RA) informed him that the Prophet (ﷺ) had said, "There is no preserve except what belongs to Allah and His Messenger." [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2111240.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111240
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 171
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 171
2111240.text: Narrated [Ibn 'Abbas (RA)]: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "There should neither be harming (of others without cause), nor reciprocating harm (between two parties)." [Reported by Ahmad and Ibn Majah].

2111250.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111250
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 172
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 172
2111250.text: Ibn Majah reported something similar to the aforesaid Hadith from Abu Sa'id's narration. It is found in al-Muwatta' in a Mursal form (missing link after the Tabi'i).

2111260.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111260
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 173
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 173
2111260.text: Narrated Samurah bin Jundub (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "If anyone puts a wall around a (barren) land, it belongs to him." [Reported by Abu Dawud and Ibn al-Jarud graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2111270.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111270
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 174
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 174
2111270.text: Narrated 'Abdullah bin Mughaffal (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ), "Whoever digs a well, shall have forty cubits (of land) as resting place for his animals near the water." [Reported by Ibn Majah through a weak chain of narrators].

2111280.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111280
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 175
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 175
2111280.text: Narrated 'Alqama bin Wa'il from his father (RA): "The Prophet (ﷺ) assigned him land in Hadramout." [Reported by Abu Dawud and at-Tirmidhi. Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2111290.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111290
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 176
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 176
2111290.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) assigned az-Zubair the land his horse could cover at a run. He made his horse run, and when it stopped he threw his whip. He then said, "Give to him up to the spot his has reached. [Reported by Abu Dawud, but it has weakness].

2111300.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111300
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 177
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 177
2111300.text: Narrated A man of the Companions (RA): I went on an expedition with the Prophet (ﷺ) and heard him say, "People are partners in three things: grazing, pasture, water and fire." [Reported by Ahmad and Abu Dawud, and its narrators are reliable (thiqah)].

2111310.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111310
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 178
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 178
2111310.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "When a son of Adam (i.e. any human being) dies his deeds are discontinued, with three exceptions: Sadaqah, whose benefit is continuous; or knowledge from which benefit continues to be reaped, or a righteous child who supplicates for him." [Reported by Muslim].

2111320.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111320
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 179
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 179
