2111320.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): 'Umar (RA) got some land in Khaibar and went to the Prophet (ﷺ) asking his command regarding it and said, "O Allah's Messenger, I have acquired a land in Khaibar which is the most valuable property that I have ever acquired." He replied, "If you wish you may make the property an endowment and give its produce as Sadaqah." So 'Umar (RA) gave the land as Sadaqah (in endowment on the condition) that must not be sold, inherited, or given away. And he gave its produce as Sadaqah to be devoted to the poor, relatives, the emancipation of salves, in Allah's Cause, for travelers and guests, and there is no sin upon the one who administers it if he eats something from it in a reasonable manner or gives something to a friend to eat, provided he does not store anything as goods (for himself). [Agreed upon; the wording is Muslim's].

2111330.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111330
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 180
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 180
2111330.text: A narration by al-Bukhari has: "He gave the land in Sadaqah (as an endowment) that must not be sold or gifted, but its produce must be spent (as Sadaqah)."

2111340.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111340
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 181
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 181
2111340.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) sent 'Umar (RA) to collect Sadaqah..." The narrator reported the Hadith and it contains:

2111350.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111350
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 182
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 182
2111350.text: "As for Khalid, he has kept back his coats of mail and weapons to use them in Allah's Cause." [Agreed upon].

2111360.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111360
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 183
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 183
2111360.text: Narrated an-Nu'man bin Bashir (RA): His father brought him to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and said, "I have given this son of mine a slave, who was belonging to me." Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) asked, "Have you given all your children the like of him?" He replied, "No." Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) then said, "Take him back then."

2111370.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111370
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 184
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 184
2111370.text: A narration has: My father went then to the Prophet (ﷺ) to call him as a witness to my Sadaqah (i.e. gift) and he asked, "Have you done the same with all your children?" He replied, "No." He said, "Fear Allah and treat your children equally." My father then returned and took back that gift. [Agreed upon].

2111380.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111380
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 185
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 185
2111380.text: A narration by Muslim has: He said, "Call someone other than me as a witness to this." He then said, "Would you like them to be equal in their kind treatment of you?" He replied, "Yes." He said, "Don't do it, then."

2111390.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111390
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 186
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 186
2111390.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "The one who repossesses a gift is like a dog which vomits and then returns to its vomit." [Agreed upon].

2111400.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111400
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 187
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 187
2111400.text: A narration by al-Bukhari has: "An evil example does not apply to us, one who repossesses a gift is like a dog which vomits and then returns to its vomit."

2111410.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111410
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 188
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 188
2111410.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar and Ibn 'Abbas (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "It is not lawful for a Muslim man to give a gift and then take it back, except a father regarding what he gives a child." [Reported by Ahmad and al-Arba'a. at-Tirmidhi, Ibn Hibban and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2111420.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111420
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 189
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 189
2111420.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) would accept a gift and give something in return for it. [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2111430.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111430
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 190
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 190
2111430.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): A man gave away a she-camel to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). So he gave him something in return for it and asked, "Are you pleased?" He replied, "No." So he gave him more and asked, "Are you pleased?" He replied, "No." Again he gave him more and asked, "Are you pleased?" He replied, "Yes." [Reported by Ahmad and Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2111440.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111440
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 191
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 191
2111440.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "What is given in life-tenancy belongs to the one to whom it is given." [Agreed upon].

2111450.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111450
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 192
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 192
2111450.text: Muslim has: "Keep your properties for yourselves and do not squander them, for if anyone gives a life-tenancy it goes to the one to whom it is given, both during his life and after his death, and to his descendants."

2111460.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111460
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 193
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 193
2111460.text: A narration has: "The life-tenancy which Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) allowed was only that in which one says, 'It is for you and your descendants.' However, if he says, 'It is yours as long as you live', it returns to its owner."

2111470.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111470
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 194
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 194
2111470.text: Abu Dawud and an-Nasa'i have: "Do not give property "to go to the survivor" and do not give "life-tenancy", for if anyone is given either, the property goes to his heirs."

2111480.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111480
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 195
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 195
2111480.text: Narrated 'Umar (RA): I provided a man with a horse to ride in Allah's Cause, but as he did not look after it well, I thought he would sell it at a cheap price. I therefore asked Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) about that and he said, "Do not buy it even if he gives it to you for a Dirham..." The narrator reported the rest of the Hadith. [Agreed upon].

2111490.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111490
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 196
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 196
2111490.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Give gifts to one another and you will love one another." [al-Bukhari reported it in al-Adab al-Mufrad; Abu Ya'la reported it with a Hasan (good) chain of narrators].

2111500.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111500
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 197
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 197
2111500.text: Narrated Anas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "Give gifts to one another, for (giving) gifts gently extracts resentment and ill-will." [al-Bazzar reported it through a Da'if (weak) chain of narrators].

2111510.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111510
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 198
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 198
2111510.text: Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "O Muslim women, a woman neighbor should not consider even a goat's hoof too insignificant a gift to give to her neighbor." [Agreed upon].

2111520.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111520
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 199
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 199
2111520.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "If anyone gives away a gift, he has most right to it as long as he is given nothing in return for it." [al-Hakim reported and graded it Sahih (authentic). However, the stronger narration is Ibn 'Umar's narration on the authority of 'Umar (RA) as a saying of 'Umar].

2111530.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111530
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 200
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 200
2111530.text: Narrated Anas (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) came upon a date on the road and said, "Were it not that I fear it may be part of the Sadaqah I would eat it." [Agreed upon].

2111540.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111540
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 201
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 201
2111540.text: Narrated Zaid bin Khalid al-Juhani (RA): A man came to the Prophet (ﷺ) and asked him about an item found (in the street). He replied, "Note what it is contained in, and what it is tied with, and make the matter known for a year. Then, if its owner comes (give it to him). Otherwise, you can do what you like with it." He asked, "What about astray sheep?" He replied, "It is for your, your brother, or the wolf." He asked, "What about astray camels?" He replied, "What have you to do with them? They have their stomachs and their feet. They can go down to water and eat trees till their master finds them." [Agreed upon].

2111590.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111590
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 202
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 202
2111590.text: Narrated [Zaid bin Khalid (RA)]: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "He who shelters a stray (animal) is astray himself if he does not make it known." [Reported by Muslim].

2111600.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111600
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 203
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 203
2111600.text: Narrated Iyad bin Himar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "He who finds something should call two trusty people as witnesses, keep in mind what it is contained in, and what it is tied with, and not conceal it or cover it up. Then, if its owner comes, he has the most right to it. Otherwise, it is Allah's property which He gives to whomever He wills." [Reported by Ahmad and al-Arba'a excluding Tirmidhi. Ibn Khuzaimah, Ibn al-Jarud and Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2111610.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111610
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 204
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 204
2111610.text: Narrated 'Abdur-Rahman bin 'Uthman at-Taimi (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) prohibited taking what a pilgrim has dropped (lost). [Reported by Muslim].

2111620.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111620
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 205
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 205
2111620.text: Narrated al-Miqdam bin Ma'dikarib (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "A beast of prey with a fang, a domestic donkey, and a lost item from the property of a Mu'ahid (a disbeliever who has been given a covenant) - unless it is something worthless - are not lawful." [Reported by Abu Dawud].

2111630.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111630
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 206
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 206
2111630.text: Narrated Ibn 'Abbas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ), "Give the prescribed shares to those who are entitled to them, and what remains goes to the nearest male relative (of the deceased)." [Agreed upon].

2111640.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111640
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 207
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 207
2111640.text: Narrated Usamah bin Zaid (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "A Muslim does not inherit from an infidel and an infidel does not inherit from a Muslim." [Agreed upon].

2111650.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111650
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 208
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 208
2111650.text: Narrated Ibn Mas'ud (RA) concerning the situation where there was a daughter, a son's daughter and a sister: The Prophet (ﷺ) ruled, "The daughter gets half and the son's daughter gets a sixth, completing two-thirds, and what remains goes to the sister." [Reported by al-Bukhari].

2111660.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111660
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 209
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 209
2111660.text: Narrated 'Abdullah bin 'Amr (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "People of two different religions do not inherit from one another." [Reported by Ahmad and al-Arba'a except at-Tirmidhi].

2111670.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111670
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 210
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 210
2111670.text: al-Hakim reported it with Usamah's wording.

2111680.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111680
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 211
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 211
2111680.text: an-Nasa'i reported Usamah's Hadith with the aforesaid wording.

2111690.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111690
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 212
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 212
2111690.text: Narrated 'Imran bin Husain (RA): A man came to the Prophet (ﷺ) and said, "My son's son (grandson) has died, so what do I receive from his estate (inheritance)?" He replied, "You receive a sixth;" then when he turned away he called him and said, "You receive another sixth;" and when he turned away he called him and said, "The other sixth is an allowance (beyond what is due)." [Reported by Ahmad and al-Arba'a. at-Tirmidhi graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2111700.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111700
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 213
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 213
2111700.text: It is from al-Hasan al-Basri's narration on the authority of 'Imran. However, it has been said that al-Hasan did not hear (Hadith) from 'Imran].

2111710.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111710
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 214
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 214
2111710.text: Narrated Ibn Buraidah (RA) on the authority of his father: The Prophet (ﷺ) appointed a sixth to a grandmother if no mother is left to inherit before her. [Reported by Abu Dawud and an-Nasa'i. Ibn Khuzaimah and Ibn al-Jarud graded it Sahih (authentic) and Ibn 'Adi graded it strong].

2111720.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111720
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 215
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 215
2111720.text: Narrated al-Miqdam bin Ma'dikarib (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "A maternal uncle is heir of him who has no inheritor." [Ahmad and al-Arba'a reported it excluding at-Tirmidhi. Abu Zur'a ar-Razi graded it Hasan (good), and al-Hakim and Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic).

2111730.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111730
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 216
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 216
2111730.text: Narrated Abu Umamah bin Sahl (RA): 'Umar (RA) wrote to Abu Ubaidah (RA) that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) had said: "Allah and His Messenger are the Patrons of him who has none and a maternal uncle is the heir of him who has no inheritor." [Reported by Ahmad and al-Arba'a except Abu Dawud. at-Tirmidhi graded it Hasan (good); Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2111740.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111740
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 217
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 217
2111740.text: Narrated Jabir (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "When a new born cries (at the time of birth) (and then dies), it is treated as a hair." [Reported by Abu Dawud and graded as Sahih (authentic) by Ibn Hibban].

2111750.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111750
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 218
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 218
2111750.text: Narrated 'Amr bin Shu'aib on his father's authority from his grandfather (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "One who kills a man cannot inherit anything from him." [Reported by an-Nasa'i and ad-Daraqutni. Ibn 'Abdul-Barr graded it Qawiy (strong), while an-Nasa'i declared it to be defective. The right opinion is that it is Mawquf (a saying of a Companion) from 'Umar].

2111760.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111760
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 219
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 219
2111760.text: Narrated 'Umar bin al-Khattab (RA): I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) as saying, "The property which a parent or a child has a right to, goes to his 'Asabah (paternal relatives) whoever it may be. [Reported by Abu Dawud, an-Nasa'i and Ibn Majah. Ibn al-Madini and Ibn 'Abdul-Barr graded it Sahih (authentic)].

2111770.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111770
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 220
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 220
2111770.text: Narrated 'Abdullah bin 'Umar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The right to inheritance from a freed slave is a relationship like the relationship of blood relatives (lineage); it cannot be sold or given away." [al-Hakim reported it through ash-Shafi'i's narration from Muhammad bin al-Hasan on the authority of Abu Yusuf. Ibn Hibban graded it Sahih (authentic), while al-Baihaqi graded it defective].

2111780.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111780
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 221
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 221
2111780.text: Narrated Abu Qilabah on the authority of Anas (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "The most versed in the rules of inheritance among you is Zaid bin Thabit." [Reported by Ahmad and al-Arba'a except Abu Dawud. at-Tirmidhi, Ibn Hibban and al-Hakim graded it Sahih (authentic). However, it was considered defective due to being Mursal (missing link in the chain after the Tabi'i)].

2111790.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111790
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 222
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 222
2111790.text: Narrated Ibn 'Umar (RA): Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "It is not permissible for a Muslim person, who has something he wants to give as a bequest, to have it for two nights without having his will regarding it written and kept ready with him." [Agreed upon].

2111800.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111800
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 223
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 223
2111800.text: Narrated Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas (RA): I said, "O Allah's Messenger, I have wealth and no one to inherit from me except my one daughter. Shall I give two-thirds of my property as Sadaqah?" He replied, "No." I said, "Shall I give half of it as Sadaqah?" He replied, "No." I said, "Shall I give a third of it as Sadaqah?" He replied, "You may give a third as Sadaqah, which is still a lot. To leave your heirs rich is better than to leave them poor and begging from people." [Agreed upon].

2111810.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111810
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 224
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 224
2111810.text: Narrated 'Aishah (RA): A man came to the Prophet (ﷺ) and said, "O Allah's Messenger, my mother had died suddenly, and did not make a will. And I think she would have given out Sadaqah if she had been able to speak, so will she get a reward if I gave out Sadaqah on her behalf?" He replied, "Yes." [Agreed upon; the wording is Muslim's].

2111820.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111820
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 225
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 225
2111820.text: Narrated Abu Umamah al-Bahili (RA): I heard Allah's Messeneger (ﷺ) saying, "Allah has appointed for everyone who has a right what is due to him, and no Wasiyah (will) should be made to an heir." [Reported by Ahmad and al-Arba'a except an-Nasa'i. Ahmad and at-Tirmidhi graded it Hasan (good), while Ibn Khuzaimah and Ibn al-Jarud graded it Qawiy (strong)].

2111830.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111830
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 226
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 226
2111830.text: ad-Daraqutni reported the aforesaid Hadith from the narration of Ibn 'Abbas (RA); and he added in its end: "unless the other heirs wish so." [Its chain of narrators is Hasan (good)].

2111840.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111840
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 227
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 227
2111840.text: Narrated Mu'adh bin Jabal (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Allah gave (a favor) as Sadaqah to you a third of your property, when you are about to die, as an increase in your good deeds." [Reported by ad-Daraqutni].

2111850.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111850
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 228
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 228
2111850.text: Ahmad and al-Bazzar reported the aforesaid narration from the Hadith of Abu ad-Darda.

2111860.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111860
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 229
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 229
2111860.text: While Ibn Majah reported it from the Hadith of Abu Hurairah (RA).

2111870.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111870
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 230
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 230
2111870.text: All of them (i.e. these three chains of narrators) are weak. However, they may strengthen one another (becoming Hasan), and Allah Knows Best.

2111880.reference:
Reference  : Bulugh al-Maram 2111880
In-book reference  : Book 7, Hadith 231
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 7, Hadith 231
